Articles.Content:
Updated to 3.10:

  • Updated KAE DLL for KSP 0.25.
  • Payload auto-struts by marce155.
Thanks for the update.

Haven't tested it yet, KSP is booting now, out of curiosity what are the payload auto-struts?

And additionally, in the config files for fairings it has a set of numbers that alter the shape of the fairing, can anyone explain just excatly what changing each one will do to the shape so I can change the shapes of ones to my liking? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Keep it cool

Haven't tested it yet, KSP is booting now, out of curiosity what are the payload auto-struts?

And additionally, in the config files for fairings it has a set of numbers that alter the shape of the fairing, can anyone explain just excatly what changing each one will do to the shape so I can change the shapes of ones to my liking? Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Keep it cool

Payload autostruts sounds like it just might be the end of wobbly payloads. Or at least a reduction of them.

Payload autostruts sounds like it just might be the end of wobbly payloads. Or at least a reduction of them.

Whatever is inside a fairing is automatically joint to the fairing base until all fairing sides have been jettisoned (then it's free again). No-wobble is something KSP can't do, but it's a bit better:

Thanks for the update e-dog!

Very nice job. +rep marce. Any chance of getting an initial buy-in cost for those of us playing hard mode?

Edited October 11, 2014 by Alshain

Whatever is inside a fairing is automatically joint to the fairing base until all fairing sides have been jettisoned (then it's free again). No-wobble is something KSP can't do, but it's a bit better:

Thanks for the update e-dog!

Excellent work on struts Marce thank you both a lot for this must have mod

I thought that auto-struts were in there already? or am I thinking of a different mod?

BTW thanks for the update, e-dog. This is one of my must-install mods

I thought that auto-struts were in there already? or am I thinking of a different mod?

BTW thanks for the update, e-dog. This is one of my must-install mods

What we had before (have had for awhile) was fairings that automagically get auto-strutted to their base. And... I think each other? maybe?

So you could have fairings that would be stock still and then have the payload come peeking out the side. Unless you strutted the payload to the fairing manually....
Is it possible to get a 0.24.2 version with the payload autostruts? It looks loke a very useful feature but I do not want to upgrade to 0.25 (at least not wiith my main save).
One of my must-have mods, thanks for all your work e-dog!

Tried using search and google for an answer and not having any luck. Does anyone know what causes this mod to spam the debug log? I was pressing keys trying to find something and think I accidently activated a debug log feature in this mod, now it's lagging the game up. There's no red errors or anything, it's just raw data. I have the same thing in my mods but I activate it via tweakables, and I've no idea how this one does it. Tried pressing every key and I'm not getting there.

Ideas? Or is this maybe a bug?

Tried using search and google for an answer and not having any luck. Does anyone know what causes this mod to spam the debug log? I was pressing keys trying to find something and think I accidently activated a debug log feature in this mod, now it's lagging the game up. There's no red errors or anything, it's just raw data. I have the same thing in my mods but I activate it via tweakables, and I've no idea how this one does it. Tried pressing every key and I'm not getting there.

Ideas? Or is this maybe a bug?

There's no such feature in PF. It might be some other mod.

There's no such feature in PF. It might be some other mod.

Looks like part of PF to me.

Looks like part of PF to me.

Looks like part of FAR/NEAR to me.

Looks like part of FAR/NEAR to me.

Fair enough. I think I'll look at updating FAR/NEAR then. Seen this before?
I've seen that as debug output from FAR. Not sure about NEAR. FAR have debug toggle in settings IIRC.

I've seen that as debug output from FAR. Not sure about NEAR. FAR have debug toggle in settings IIRC.

I think NEAR has a setting .cfg in the near install folder.

Has anyone mentioned that there is no cost to unlock these parts? Just throwing in there that for some of us that does matter, free parts are sort of a big deal when it comes to unlocking the tech tree.

EDIT: Good, it has been mentioned. I'm a dummy. Still, I support part costs!
TouhouTorpedo: that's perfectly normal output from FAR (or NEAR): it tells you the stats of the drag model applied to whatever part you just placed.

Is there any way to increase the maximum fairing base diameter in career mode?

I'm using the Seadragon mod and so I need 15m fairings.
Hello, I downloaded and installed the new version, and one of the fairing bases seems missing the texture.
YAY! It's finally updated! This is by far my favorite fairing mod and I intend to make thorough use of the new version.
Kirondoll: stock KSP issue, the TGA loader breaks randomly on .25.

Hello there, got an issue with this mod... My docking stage option to open the fairing disappear sometime.

Do you have any idea why? Was working fine with the previous release, even on .25 version of the game.

// EDIT 1: Reinstall of the mod seems to have solved the issue... //

// EDIT 2: I would like to apologize, I'm such an idiot! I found what happened, I put the wrong type of fairings on the base... with the right one from the right category of parts, it's working perfectly fine... And I LOVE your add-on by the way //

Edited October 13, 2014 by FrancoisH
Not an issue.
